meanings.definition: The act of breaking or bursting suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The loud ruptures of the fireworks startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused ruptures in the ground, creating cracks.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's ruptures made it a funny sight at the party.
meanings.sent4: The ruptures in the dam threatened the safety of the town.
meanings.sent5: The ruptures in the old bridge showed its age and wear.

meanings.definition: A breach or tear in a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's ruptures carefully.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's injury resulted in painful ruptures in his muscles.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's exaggerated ruptures always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ruptures in the fabric of reality allowed for unexpected events.
meanings.sent5: The ruptures in the skin required immediate medical attention.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise ruptures the silence of the night.
meanings.sent2: The pressure buildup caused the pipe to rupture unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made the audience rupture with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The news of the scandal will rupture the peace in the community.
meanings.sent5: The emotional stress can rupture relationships if not addressed.
